title: 'Era of Tanks' caters to NOOBS.
body:
What was one of the main complaints that people had about assassins and ADCs? It was that they didn't have to **WORRY ABOUT POSITIONING**. Now this was the logic that made me laugh; "Assassins and ADCs do not have to worry about positioning. They just roll their faces on the keyboard and they're safe, cause everyone's dead."

I totally disagree with this. Regardless of how fed an assassin/ADC is, they have to constantly be worried about positioning because will be focused.

Now lets look at the 'Era of Tanks'. They require zero strategy what-so-ever. They don't have to worry about positioning because they just have to be in the front. **Their only job is to walk to their opposing team and stand in the middle**. THIS REQUIRES SO MUCH SKILL, SO MUCH THOUGHT.

Please, let's not kid ourselves. This is the noobiest strategy ever, and Tanks shouldn't be so powerful that they don't have to worry about taking damage.

You were against a full team of Bronze 5s and still lost, kda has nothing to do with performance. Being a tank isn't simply standing up front, you have to properly use your cc if you are a cc tank, you have to decide when to go in as most of the times when you pick a tank the team will wait for you before doing anything, if you're more of a fighter tank like Mundo you actually have to be landing Qs to be a threat. Many of them can't escape any situation like some adcs can and assassins, yes they are tankier, but late game they aren't indestructible like many people like to claim. They also aren't being babysat or peeled for, if they are in a poor position they are on their own.

A tank deciding to go in at the wrong time, ccing the wrong people, or messing up can cause a team fight to be lost instantly. I have won many games simply because the opposing tank jungler picked a tank just because it's "what everyone is doing" and didn't use their ults/cc properly and we ended up winning. They also have to decide what to build, where as adcs literally build the same things every game in the same exact order.

I do understand and agree that tanks are very important.  In fact, you could even argue that tanks are the **most important** role in a team.  But to say they're hard to play is a bit of an exaggeration.

Enemy team is majority AD, build these: {{item:3143}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3075}} 
Enemy team is majority AP, build these: {{item:3102}} {{item:3105}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3190}} 

{{champion:32}} Locate enemy carry, land bandage toss, PRESS R
{{champion:113}} Charge in with Q, find enemy carry, aim, PRESS R
{{champion:57}} PRESS R, locate enemy carry, PRESS W

The thing is, yes you have to make the correct decision and choose the right teamfight.  But tanks have so much health/resistances, that they have more leeway to make mistakes.  You can miss your ult, and if your teammates are smart, they'll peel and try again in a minute.

But a carry is different, they're squishy.  And if they mess up once, they die.

Honestly, the easiest role in teamfights are by far the assassins and AD carries, you literally wait for someone or your tank to initiate, then you jump into the fray once they're whittled down. Call it boring, but I've played tanks, assassins and ADC, but tanks by far have the most level of pressure in a team fight with when and how to initiate them, bad initiation, your team is boned, good initiation, your team wins. ADC love to act like they're the gods of the Rifts, but really, its laughable. 

There's nothing boring about the game play, unless you of course enjoy right clicking a player once to kill them or face rolling as an assassin to kill an entire team, I'll take tanks and having to THINK about what its I'm doing as oppose to other roles, knowing how to initiate, get all 5 members of a team to focus on you long enough so your team can wipe them out and you can still live, significantly easier said than done.

Assassins/ADCs get fed and they 3 shot everyone else while stealing back one sixth of their health bar in one AA.

Tanks/Bruisers get fed and they turn into raid bosses from WoW.

Both sides are capable of being overpowered or underpowered. It takes no more skill to land a skill shot while playing a tanky champion such as Sejuani than to land a skill shot while playing an assassin such as Zed.

I used to play exclusively high burst and DPS champions in League, but after playing some more durable champions, I would say they take around the same skill.
Most tanks starts off with awesome innate abilities that lets them sit on carries; however, as the game progresses, offensive builds absolutely wrecks tank items as tanks get kited to death.

Damage champions start off difficult with low damage output and durability, but they become easier and stronger as they get items. Tank champions have a smoother start, but gets completely screwed over by offensive items such as BoTRK and LS later on.

it is a fair trade, but if I were to pick a side, I would rather have stronger assassins and marksmen. The main quarrel with strong tanks is that if so, everyone will play tanks and LoL will turn into a giant slap fight with no one ever dying past 30 minutes.

No I totally understand the role of tanks.  It's to soak up the damage in team fights while doing just enough damage to disrupt the enemy team, where you put doubts in their mind that they can't win, so they hesitate and try to peel.  Just that 1 second of hesitation gives your carries enough time to kill the enemy.

I understand exactly what the roles of tanks are.  Normally, if I play tank well, I usually go like 5/5/15 while my carries get fed.  In fact, I prefer being the tank for my team, because I trust myself to sacrifice my champ so my team can win the teamfights.

**With that said, I don't want Tanks to become the strongest role in League.  Because overall, tanks are a very boring role.**

Maybe I'll die in the process, but because I'm ahead, I survive just long enough where the enemy will die to my team.  It's too easy.
